p:
The relative contribution of transmission by sexual activity to overall transmission is presented in Table 2, together with the attack rate from November to April 1996â€“2015 in the 11 Australian UCLs. In Brisbane, Cairns, Darwin, Rockhampton, Thursday Island and Townsville, sexual transmission contributed less than 63.0% in R
0 ('best-case' scenario) and less than 35.0% in R
0 ('worst-case' scenario) for Aedes aegypti, while for Aedes albopictus, sexual transmission represented the major contribution of ZIKV transmission (above 98%).
